entry.title: European leaders working hard to keep Greece in eurozone
entry.summary: A flag which says "stop" and has euro money signs in the EU stars flaps in the wind during a protest march in solidarity with Greece in the center of Brussels on Sunday, June 21, 2015.

entry.title: European Leaders Working Hard to Keep Greece in Eurozone
entry.summary: Greece is facing a June 30 deadline to make a 1.6 billion euro ($1.8 billion) loan repayment to the International Monetary Fund, which, at present, it would be unable to make, and even bigger payments to the ECB in July.

entry.title: European leaders working hard to keep Greece in eurozone
entry.summary: Hollande said that "if the Greeks leave the eurozone it won't be positive for the Greeks or Europeans."

entry.title: European leaders working hard to keep Greece in eurozone
entry.summary: Later Hollande told reporters in Milan, where he met with Italian Premier Matteo Renzi, that everything must be done to keep financially-ailing Greece in the Eurozone.

entry.title: European leaders working hard to keep Greece in eurozone
French leftists rally in support of Greece
entry.summary: Greece's new radical leftist government is in a stand-off with international creditors to reach a loan deal to avoid defaulting on debt payments at the end of the month, threatening an exit from the 19-nation eurozone.

entry.title: French leftists rally in support of Greece ahead of Monday eurozone summit
entry.summary: PARIS - Several thousand leftists have rallied in Paris to "give Greece a chance" two days ahead of a critical summit of eurozone leaders on a bailout.

entry.title: Greek premier Tsipras, ministers discuss strategy, proposals for next week's Eurozone summit
entry.summary: ATHENS, Greece - Two days before a crucial summit of Eurozone leaders, Greek ministers are huddling to discuss strategy and assemble a new package of proposals, officials say.

entry.title: Eurozone hopes Greek criticism will bear fruit
entry.summary:
Greece's finance minister came under fire Friday from his peers in the 19-country eurozone for failing to come up with a comprehensive list of economic reforms that are needed if the country is to get vital loans to avoid going bankrupt.

In the Latvian capital of Riga, the eurozone's top official, Jeroen Dijsselbloem, said he hopes "some extra urgency" will be injected into the process following the "critical" meeting of the eurozone's 19 finance ministers the day before.

Just two months ago, Greece secured an agreement from the eurozone to get the remaining money in its bailout fund - 7.2 billion euros ($7.7 billion) - but only if it came up with a mutually agreed set of reforms.

On Saturday, as they arrived for talks with their non-euro partners in the 28-country European Union, finance ministers sought to downplay talk of a Greek debt default and the country's exit from the euro.

entry.title: Asian stock markets slip, euro slides as Greek debt talks appear to go nowhere
Eurozone deflation eases as oil prices appear to bottom out
entry.summary:
Separate Eurostat figures Tuesday showed the jobless rate in the eurozone down at 11.3 percent in February from 11.4 percent the previous month.

On Tuesday, the euro was down another 0.9 percent at $1.0722 as traders price in the prospect of higher U.S. borrowing rates soon.

entry.title: Asia Stocks Slip, Euro Down as Greek Debt Talks Falter
entry.summary: Asian stocks slipped and the euro sank Monday as Greece inched closer to a possible default after weekend talks with international creditors over freeing up the rest of its bailout funds went nowhere.

entry.title: Asia stocks slip, euro down as Greek debt talks falter
entry.summary: CURRENCIES: The euro faltered on news of the Greek debt impasse, falling nearly 0.5 percent to $1.1207 from $1.1260 in late trading Friday.

entry.title: Greek uncertainty acting as 'brake on growth' in eurozone
entry.summary: Overall, Eurostat found unemployment across the eurozone fell by 130,000 in April, pushing the jobless rate down to 11.1 percent from 11.2 percent.

entry.title: Euro slips, mood darkens as Greece fails to reach deal
entry.summary: The euro skidded 0.4 percent on the day to $1.1215 EUR=, and was down 0.5 percent against the yen at 138.28 EURJPY=.

entry.title: Greek Uncertainty Continues to Weigh on Global Markets
entry.summary: EUROZONE INFLATION: While most of the focus has been on developments surrounding Greece, there was some interest in the news that consumer prices in the 19-country eurozone are rising for the first time since last November.

entry.title: Faeroe Islands beat Greece again in Euro 2016 qualifying

entry.summary: Kyle Lafferty and Oliver Norwood were denied in a tense finale as Northern Ireland's crunch Euro 2016 qualifier against Romania ended in stalemate at Windsor Park.

entry.title: Interpol suspends 20 million euro partnership with Fifa
Belgium finds way to issue its own Waterloo euro coin
Belgium finds way to issue its own Waterloo euro coin
entry.summary: This week, Belgium decided to circumvent French resistance by invoking a little-known European Union rule that allows countries to issue euro coins of their choice, provided they are in an irregular denomination.

entry.title: GLOBAL MARKETS-Euro at 3-month high, bond yields key
entry.summary: Investors digested figures from the previous day that showed relatively strong euro zone economic growth in the first quarter, contrasting with disappointingly weak U.S. retail sales in April.

entry.title: Asian stocks sag, Greek worries continue to dog euro
entry.summary: The euro was little changed at $1.0742, having shed 0.9 percent overnight.

entry.title: European shares fall amid Greek impasse, weak euro zone data
entry.summary: Greece's government intends to reach an agreement on a cash-for-reforms deal by Sunday, its spokesman said on Thursday, even as euro zone officials suggested a deal was far from imminent.

entry.title: European shares fall amid Greek impasse, weak euro zone data
entry.summary: European indexes extended losses after data showed euro zone private sector loans stopped rising in April.

entry.title: Neither Grexit, nor Grexident. Euro and 'drachma' in parallel?
entry.summary:
BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Greece is unlikely to exit the euro, either intentionally or accidentally.

But it might be forced to introduce an alternative means of payment, in parallel to the euro, to pay some domestic bills if a reform-for-cash deal with its creditors is not secured soon, several euro zone officials said.

"At some point, when the government has no more euros to pay salaries or bills, it might start issuing IOUs -- a paper saying that its holder would receive an x number of euros at a point in time in the future," one senior euro zone official said.

"Such IOUs would then quickly start trading in secondary circulation at a deep discount to the real euros and they would become a 'currency', whatever its name would be, that would exist in parallel to the euro," the official said.

"The arrangement could be temporary to keep the government going as it hopes to negotiate a deal with creditors that would unlock more euros in loans," a second euro zone official said.

"If they were to default, it is better to do that inside the euro zone rather than outside, because then it would become a problem of all the countries sharing the euro, rather than just Greece," a third official said.

"There is no means of forcing a country out of the euro zone or out of the European Union and Greece has no intention of leaving on its own," the second euro zone official said.

entry.title: Eurozone period of falling prices ends in April
entry.summary: Tom Rogers, senior economic adviser to the EY Eurozone Forecast, said the unchanged unemployment rate was "somewhat disappointing" but held out the hope that there will be improvements in the months to come.

entry.title: Euro-Pro recalls 143K vacuum cleaners because of shock risk
entry.summary:
The agency says consumers should contact Euro-Pro to get a replacement wand.

It says Euro-Pro has received 62 reports of the wand detaching from the handle of the vacuum cleaner, but hasn't received any reports of injuries.

The Consumer Product Safety Commission said Euro-Pro Operating LLC is recalling four models of its Shark brand Rotator Powered Lift-Airway vacuum cleaner.

entry.summary: As a result, the euro's fall against Asian currencies has driven up their costs.

entry.title: Injured Iniesta to miss Spain's Euro qualifier with Belarus
entry.summary: BARCELONA, June 7 (Reuters) - Barcelona midfielder Andres Iniesta will miss Spain's Euro 2016 qualifier in Belarus due to injury, it has been confirmed on the national team's website on Sunday.

entry.title: Greece to bundle its June IMF payments together
entry.summary: Tourist walks past a discount shop which reads in Greek "thousand of products from one Euro" on Thursday, June 4, 2015.

entry.title: Greece to bundle its June IMF payments together
entry.summary: A woman stands in front of graffiti depicting a zero Euro coin in Athens on Thursday, June 4, 2015.

entry.title: Greece to Bundle Its June IMF Payments Together
entry.summary:
Without the money, it will struggle to pay upcoming debts and the country could soon go bankrupt - a possible preamble to a forced exit from the euro and a return to a financial stone age with a devalued version of its old national currency.

Inability to repay creditors or pay pensions and public sector salaries could cause havoc involving capital controls and an unprecedented departure from the 19-country eurozone.

entry.title: China shares sink, euro rides high as yields spike
entry.summary: TOKYO (Reuters) - The euro continued riding high on Thursday thanks to a spike in euro zone debt yields, while in Asian equities volatile Chinese shares slid and tempered risk sentiment.

entry.title: Euro zone business growth loses some steam in May
entry.summary:
Euro zone business growth lost a little momentum last month despite companies cutting prices again.

The deceleration in growth will be disappointing for the European Central Bank, coming just a few months after it embarked on a trillion-euro quantitative easing programme to try and drive growth and fuel inflation.

entry.title: Euro zone retail sales up, unemployment down
entry.summary: Euro zone retail sales rose and unemployment fell in April, the European Union's statistics office data showed today, adding to signs of economic recovery in the single currency area.

entry.title: Greek uncertainty acting as 'brake on growth' in eurozone
entry.summary:
LONDON (AP) - Uncertainty over Greece is weighing on the eurozone economy, a closely-watched survey found Wednesday, as the clock was ticking on the country's efforts to avoid bankruptcy.

Without a deal that would release remaining bailout funds, Greece faces bankruptcy and a possible exit from the euro, a development that could roil the 19-country eurozone.

Despite a modest deceleration in Spain's pace of growth, Markit said the country was the best-performing major eurozone economy.

entry.title: Greek uncertainty acting as 'brake on growth' in eurozone
Eurozone job growth accelerates
entry.summary: "The eurozone recovery lost some of the wind from its sails in May, with growth of output and new orders both slowing to three-month lows," said Chris Williamson, Markit's chief economist.

entry.summary: Earlier this year, the ECB announced a 1.1 trillion-euro ($1.2 trillion) monetary stimulus in the hope that the newly created money in the economy could stoke inflationary pressures.

entry.title: Dollar Nears Three-Month Low Against the Euro
entry.summary: By early afternoon, the euro was trading around 0.7% higher against the dollar, surpassing the $1.14 mark for the first time since late February.

entry.title: Euro at three-month high, bond yields key
entry.summary:
"The euro is continuing to rebound, supported by the ongoing adjustment higher in euro zone yields. (This)... is in part supported by strengthening growth in the euro zone and higher inflation expectations," said Lee Hardman, currency strategist at BTMU in London.

The euro was up more than 0.5 percent on the day at $1.1415, as the U.S.-German 10-year yield spread narrowed to a three-month low of 152 basis points.

entry.title: Premarket: Euro at three-month high, bond yields key
entry.summary:
The euro hit a three-month high against the dollar on Thursday, drawing further support from a sustained surge in euro zone government bond yields that again kept global stock markets on the defensive.

The euro rose above $1.14, bringing its gains against the U.S. currency in the last month to nearly 9 per cent as the difference between benchmark U.S. and euro zone 10-year yields shrinks from the euro-lifetime high touched in March.

entry.title: Eurozone growth outstrips US despite fresh Greek recession
entry.summary:
The eurozone economy is growing faster than the U.S. and at its highest tick in nearly two years despite a disappointing slowdown in Germany and recession's return in Greece.

The eurozone also grew far faster than the U.S., which saw output expand at a paltry quarterly rate of 0.1 percent largely because of bad weather - on an annualized basis, which is a more common way of measuring growth in the U.S., the eurozone grew at around 1.6 percent against the U.S.'s 0.2 percent.

Other plus points include the 0.3 percent growth recorded in Italy - its first expansion since the third quarter of 2013 - and a surprise 0.6 percent rebound in France, the eurozone's second-largest economy.

entry.title: Eurozone growth outstrips US despite fresh Greek recession
entry.summary: The economy of the 19 countries that use the euro grew by a quarterly rate of 0.4 percent in the first three months ahead, Eurostat, the European Union's statistical agency, said Wednesday.

entry.title: Eurozone economy grows at fastest rate in nearly 2 years
entry.summary: Greece, which is in the midst of protracted bailout talks with creditors that may see it leaving the euro, saw its economy shrink by 0.2 percent in the first three months.

entry.title: Eurozone economy grows at fastest rate in nearly 2 years
entry.summary: Still, the rate is likely to be a slight disappointment to many policymakers across the region considering the beneficial backdrop for the eurozone economy.

entry.title: Eurozone growth at 0.4 pct in Q1, highest in nearly 2 years
entry.summary: It matches the rate recorded when the eurozone emerged from its longest-ever recession in the second quarter of 2013.

entry.title: German bund yields climb, lift euro; stocks ease

German Bund yields have surged in recent weeks, boosted by optimism that inflation may have bottomed in the euro region, according to some analysts.

The U.S. dollar slumped against the euro for the first time in four trading sessions following the spike in German Bund yields.

entry.title: Asia stocks, euro falter as Greek woes sap confidence
entry.summary:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Asian stocks edged lower and the euro sagged on Tuesday as insufficient progress on talks between debt-strapped Greece and its creditors kept investors on edge.

In a closely-watched Eurogroup meeting on Monday, euro zone finance ministers welcomed progress in negotiations between Greece and its creditors but said more work is needed for a cash-for-reform deal.

The common currency surged to a two-month high of $1.1392 on Thursday when markets were focused on improving prospects for the European economy and surging euro zone bond yields.

entry.title: Eurozone countries: progress made with Greece over bailout but more time and effort needed
entry.summary: BRUSSELS (AP) - Eurozone countries: progress made with Greece over bailout but more time and effort needed.

entry.title: Alexandre Lamfalussy, helped found euro currency, dies at 86
entry.summary:
It called him "one of the euro's founding fathers."

The ECB sets interest rates for the countries that use the euro currency.

entry.title: Alexandre Lamfalussy, helped found euro currency, dies at 86
entry.summary: The euro was introduced on Jan. 1, 1999.

entry.title: Alexandre Lamfalussy, helped found euro currency, dies at 86
entry.summary:
FRANKFURT, Germany (AP) - Belgian economist Alexandre Lamfalussy, who headed the institution that became the European Central Bank and was credited as one of the founders of the euro currency, has died at age 86.

Lamfalussy headed the Frankfurt-based European Monetary Institute from 1994-97, laying the groundwork for the introduction of the euro and a supra-national central bank to manage the currency.

entry.title: Asia slides, euro at 2-month peak as global bond rout rattles markets
entry.summary:
The euro continued to get support from a surge in euro zone bond yields, notably on German Bunds, in light of an easing in deflation fears thanks to improving European data.

In addition to sending chills through financial markets worldwide, the retreat in euro zone bonds has also weighed on U.S. Treasuries and Japanese government bonds, pushing their 10-year yields to two-month highs.

entry.title: Asia slides, euro at two-month peak as global bond rout rattles markets
entry.summary:
Shrinking expectations for an early rate hike - a tightening in June appears less and less likely - weighed on the dollar and helped its counterparts like the yen and euro.

Just last month it had hit a record low of 0.05 percent, when hopes were high that the ECB's trillion euro bond buying quantitative easing program would drive the yield into negative territory.

"The euro's bounce could stop if Bund yields steady, but without hints of further ECB easing it could be hard to keep the currency from rising again."

entry.title: Mixed signals emerge for eurozone economy
entry.summary: Figures next week are expected to show that the eurozone expanded by a quarterly rate of 0.4 percent in the first three months.

entry.title: Mixed Signals Emerge for Eurozone Economy
entry.summary:
Following a solid start to the year, signs emerged Wednesday that the 19-country eurozone economy is losing some traction.

Though the Markit survey suggested that the eurozone economy continues to grow, official figures from the European Union's statistics agency suggested that consumer demand may be coming off the boil following a decent start to the year.

entry.title: EU raises eurozone forecast despite bleaker Greek outlook
entry.summary: The two sides have been locked in talks for months but there are some hopes that a deal may be seen on May 11 at a meeting of the eurozone's 19 finance ministers in Brussels.

entry.title: EU raises eurozone forecast despite bleaker Greek outlook
entry.summary:
BRUSSELS (AP) - The European Union has nudged up its forecast for economic growth across the 19-country eurozone despite a much gloomier outlook for Greece.

In its spring forecast published Tuesday, the EU's executive branch said it is predicting 1.5 percent growth for the eurozone in 2015, up 0.2 percentage points from the previous forecast in February.

For 2016, the Commission has kept its forecast of 1.9 percent for the eurozone.

entry.title: Buffett, Munger both say euro is flawed and needs changes
entry.summary:
But Bufffett says he thinks the euro will likely be saved.

Munger says part of the problem is that some of the wrong countries were allowed to join the euro.

entry.title: Buffett, Munger both say euro is flawed and needs changes
entry.summary:
Billionaires Warren Buffett and Charlie Munger both agree that the euro needs to be reformed if it is going to survive.

Berkshire Hathaway shareholders asked Buffett and Munger about the euro at Saturday's annual meeting.

entry.title: Mitchell magic seals Toulon's Euro treble
Eurozone Period of Falling Prices Ends in April
entry.summary: The drop in consumer prices in the eurozone has come to an end after four months, easing concerns about a long-term decline that can choke the economy.

entry.title: Eurozone's stretch of falling consumer prices ends in April
entry.summary: Most economic figures over the past few months have shown an uptick in eurozone economic activity, though concerns over Greece appear to be having an effect again.

entry.title: Euro zone exits deflation - just
Eurozone period of falling prices ends in April
entry.summary: Energy costs were the main reason why consumer prices in the eurozone fell between December and March.

entry.title: Eurozone period of falling prices ends in April
entry.summary:
Fears that a long-lasting period of falling prices could weigh on the eurozone economy were largely behind the European Central Bank's recently launched 1.1 trillion-euro ($1.2 trillion) monetary stimulus.

Elsewhere, Eurostat also said unemployment across the eurozone was unchanged in March at 11.3 percent.

entry.title: France sells 24 Rafale fighter jets to Qatar
entry.summary: PARIS (AP) - France has announced a 6.3-billion-euro ($7 billion) deal to sell 24 Rafale fighter jets to Qatar.

entry.title: Stocks slip, euro near two-month high as US economy loses steam
entry.summary:
The drop in Asian equities followed Wednesday's slide in U.S and European stocks, with Germany's DAX - which hit a record high earlier this month - tumbling 3.2 percent on the euro's surge.

The euro was down 0.2 percent at $1.1107 after surging to a near two-month high of $1.1188 in the wake of the U.S. data.

entry.title: Stocks slip, euro near 2-month high as US economy loses steam
Accuracy the key to Ko's dominance, says Euro number one
European shares hit by weak earnings and rebound in euro
entry.summary: LONDON, April 29 (Reuters) - A batch of weaker-than-expected corporate results deflated European shares on Wednesday, while a rebound in the euro currency also pegged back the region's stock markets.

entry.title: U.S. Stocks cool ahead of Fed, pound skids on disappointing GDP
entry.summary:
The pound had been hovering at a near two-month high but the data pushed it down to $1.5188 from $1.5258 and to 1.39 from 1.40 versus the euro.

The euro was in focus too, having climbed to a three-week peak of $1.0927, well off its 12-year nadir of $1.0457 plumbed in mid-March.

entry.title: Half of investors expect Greece to leave euro zone within 12 months-Sentix
entry.summary:
"European politicians' promises to pursue the scenario of Greece keeping the euro are not taken at face value by about half of all investors," Sentix said in a statement.

The breakup index for the euro zone as a whole climbed to 49.0 percent in April from 36.8 percent in March, driven by the increase in expectations that Athens would quit the bloc.

That put it at about the same level as during the peak of the euro zone debt crisis in 2012.

However, Sentix's index measuring the risk of contagion fell to a record low of 26.1 percent, meaning that investors do not generally expect the Greek debt crisis to spread to other parts of the euro zone.

entry.title: Eurozone express hopes that Greek criticism will bear fruit
entry.summary:
Greece's Yanis Varoufakis was rebuked for failing to come up with a list of economic reforms, which are needed so Greece can get money it needs to stay solvent and avoid a potential exit from the euro.

Greece has relied on 240 billion euros in bailout loans since May 2010 from its euro partners and IMF after it was locked out of international bond markets amid concerns it was insolvent.

entry.title: Eurozone express hopes that Greek criticism will bear fruit
Eurozone express hopes that Greek criticism will bear fruit
entry.summary: "Greece must remain in the eurozone."

entry.title: Eurozone hopes Greek criticism will bear fruit
entry.summary: "There is only one plan, and that's Greece in the euro, Greece in Europe."

entry.title: Euro zone warns Greece no cash till full reform deal
entry.summary:
But Dijsselbloem said finance ministers would review progress again only on May 11 - a day before Greece has to make a crucial and uncertain 750 million euro payment to the International Monetary Fund.

"Our message today is very clear: We need to accelerate, we need to accelerate from today ... there is no other choice if we want to reach the goal that everyone shares, which is a stable, prosperous Greece anchored in the euro zone," Moscovici said.

entry.title: Euro zone warns Greece no cash till full reform deal
entry.summary: The impact of a potential Greek default is the biggest risk to the euro zone's economic recovery after a long crisis from which the 19-nation currency area is finally emerging.

entry.title: 'Time running out' for Greece deal
entry.summary:
The eurozone's top official has said "time is running out" for Greece to reach a deal with bailout creditors.

Many in the markets think Greece has until May 11, when eurozone finance ministers are scheduled to meet next, to secure a deal.

entry.title: Euro zone recovery just got a 'reality check'
entry.summary: "Euro zone manufacturing and services expansion unexpectedly moderated in April according to the purchasing managers, perhaps providing a reality check on the strength of the region's upturn."

entry.title: Shares, euro sag after euro zone PMIs disappoint
Wall St mixed; euro rises against dollar
Upbeat earnings lift stocks, Greek anxiety hits euro
entry.summary: Asian, African and Latin American currencies have been forced down by the dollar but eastern Europe in contrast is struggling with the euro's weakness.

entry.title: Upbeat earnings lift stocks, Greek anxiety hits euro
entry.summary: "The full extent of a Greek exit (from the euro) is not being priced in," said Grant Peterkin, manager of absolute return bond fund at Lombard Odier.

entry.title: Upbeat earnings lift global stocks, Greek anxiety hits euro
entry.summary:
"In macro terms at least, the worst of the crisis looks like it is over for the euro zone and certainly my own 'misery indices' are looking less bad," said Neil Williams, chief economist at fund manager Hermes in London.

Even after several rounds of negotiations, hopes are slim that Athens will be able to convince euro zone finance ministers to continue their financial support at the latest in a series of meetings on Friday.

An unprecedented debt default in the currency bloc could open the way for Greece to exit the euro, though ECB Vice President Vitor Constancio said on Monday that a country that defaults would not have to ditch the currency.

entry.title: Premarket: Upbeat earnings lift world stocks, Greek anxiety hits euro
SAP see sales surge, aided by cheap euro
entry.summary:
German business software maker SAP reported a 15 percent rise in operating profit helped by a cheap euro, even as rising investment in newer cloud-based software squeezed its profit margin.

Including the effect of the weaker euro, which makes the multinational software maker's products and services more competitive outside Europe, operating profit is expected to grow as much as 18 percent, the company said.

That is slightly lower than SAP's prediction last month, that profit could rise by 19 percent, reflecting the modest strengthening of the euro since then.

entry.title: Euro working group to meet Wednesday, deal still sought: Greek official
entry.summary:
"The two sides agreed that there will be a Euro Working Group meeting on Wednesday," the official close to the talks said, declining to be named.

Deputy ministers of the so-called Euro Working Group, usually prepare meetings of euro zone finance ministers.

Athens is stuck in negotiations with its euro zone partners and the International Monetary Fund over economic reforms required by its lenders to unlock remaining bailout funds.

Talks are not expected to produce a deal for the approval of euro zone finance ministers at their meeting in Riga on Friday as progress has been painfully slow.

entry.title: CAS hears Serbia, Albania appeal after Euro 2016 drone match
entry.summary:
However, Serbia was deducted all three points for the win and ordered to host two Euro 2016 qualifiers in an empty stadium.

At the midway point in the five-team group, Portugal and Denmark are in the two automatic qualifying places for Euro 2016 in France.

entry.title: Premarket: Euro zone bond yields sink to historic lows
entry.summary: The euro was 0.5 per cent lower at $1.0630, weighed down by ECB President Mario Draghi's commitment on Wednesday to seeing the central bank fulfill its bond-buying program.

entry.title: Euro zone bond yields sink to historic lows
entry.summary:
Borrowing costs in peripheral euro zone bond markets like Spain and Italy rose, however, as the prospect of Greece and the euro zone reaching agreement appeared to fade.

"From the perspective of the euro we have one clear conclusion: the message from Draghi is that nothing has changed and that we are only at the very start of the QE easing that is coming," said Derek Halpenny, senior currency strategist at BTMU in London.

entry.title: European vacations about 25% cheaper because of drop in euro's value
entry.summary: China's currency has risen some 20% against the euro over the last year.

entry.title: European vacation as much as 25 percent cheaper due to euro
entry.summary:
LISBON, Portugal (AP) - Vacations in Europe have a new attraction: the euro's steep drop in value is making the continent much cheaper for tourists from across the world, especially the United States and China.

The euro was trading at $1.057 on Wednesday, having been as high as $1.40 a year ago.

Tim Cooper, a global economist at BMI Research in London, says his company expects the euro and dollar to reach parity later this year.

entry.title: Another euro PaperlinX business collapses
Premarket: Nokia-Alcatel talks, weak euro buoy European shares
entry.summary:
Five weeks into the European Central Bank's 1 trillion euro bond-buying scheme, European share indices are at 14-year highs and the euro is struggling against the dollar and other major currencies.

That followed a 3.7 per cent jump last week, helped by further declines in an already weak euro that is seen supporting an economic recovery and boosting corporate profits.

entry.title: Nokia-Alcatel talks, weak euro buoy European shares
entry.summary: The euro fell to as low as 126.08 yen (EURJPY=) after the comments from Koichi Hamada, an economic advisor to Japanese PM Shinzo Abe.

entry.title: China shares pause for GDP test, euro pressured
entry.summary:
The euro led the way lower with a drop to 126.35 yen, depths not visited since June 2013 and the sixth straight session of losses.

The euro also eased to $1.0543, from an early rise to $1.0570, having fallen as low as $1.0519 on Monday.

entry.title: Greece casts shadow as ECB money printing buoys euro zone
entry.summary:
Athens was first bailed out almost five years ago by the euro zone with another aid deal in 2012 but its future remains uncertain.

"The euro crisis is not over. But the currency union is in a sweet spot, with a lower euro and oil prices helping the economy," said UBS economist Martin Lueck.

"QE can help to repair the euro zone economy but it is too early yet to judge its chances."

Draghi is likely to address the euro zone's improving prospects.

entry.title: NZ dollar rises to new record against euro
entry.summary:
The New Zealand dollar rose to a fresh record against the euro and commentators say it is likely to continue to break new ground as a stronger local economy contrasts with weakness in Europe.

The New Zealand dollar has gained 10 per cent against the euro so far this year as a comparatively weaker European economy and the region's loose monetary policy contrasts with New Zealand's relatively stronger outlook.

entry.title: European shares hit highest since 2000 as euro falls
entry.summary: The euro fell to 1.0607 against the dollar on Friday, having slipped more than 3 percent this week.

entry.title: European shares at highest level since 2000 as euro slips again
entry.summary:
LONDON/PARIS, April 10 (Reuters) - European shares powered ahead to their highest level since 2000 on Friday as the euro weakened to its lowest since mid-March.

The euro's fall over the past year is seen supporting a recovery in the region's growth and in corporate profits.

Strategists have said a drop of 10 percent in the euro versus a basket of currencies translates into a 6 to 8 percent rise in European profits.

entry.title: European shares at highest level since 2000 as euro slips again
entry.summary: With the euro down about 16 percent against the other currencies over the past year, profits are poised to get a 10-13 percent boost.

entry.title: European stocks, boosted by ECB stimulus and a slumping euro, climb to record high
European stocks, boosted by ECB stimulus and a slumping euro, climb to record high
entry.summary: The euro is currently trading at $1.06 and many analysts expect it to fall to parity with the U.S. currency this year.

entry.title: European Stocks, Boosted by Stimulus, Hit All-Time High
entry.summary: Stocks in Europe are jumping after the European Central Bank introduced a 1.1 trillion euro ($1.2 billion) bond-buying program to boost the region's economy.

entry.title: European stocks, boosted by stimulus, hit all-time high
entry.summary:
The euro region, a net oil importer, is also benefiting from falling energy costs and a weakening euro.

The combination of falling bond yields and the comparatively weak outlook for the region's economy has also had the side effect of weakening the euro against the dollar.

entry.title: European stocks, boosted by stimulus, hit all-time high
entry.summary: They have "low rates and very low energy prices there and then added on top of that ... the low euro is going to be very beneficial."

entry.title: Euro zone sets Greece reform deadline ahead of IMF repayment
entry.summary: "From the Greek side there was a strong statement that liquidity is getting really bad and there was an appeal to release some type of liquidity support before the euro zone finance ministers' meeting on April 24," a euro zone aide said.

entry.title: OECD says euro zone economy accelerating
entry.summary:
In a monthly update, the OECD said that within the euro zone, France and Italy were showing signs of better growth and that the outlook was also improving in Germany, the euro zone's largest economy.

The international think tank's leading indicator, a measure supposed to capture turning points in the economy, rose to 100.7 for the euro zone as a whole, from 100.6 a month earlier.

With 100 representing a long-term average, the OECD index rose to 100.7 from 100.5 in France, the second-largest euro zone economy, and increased to 101.0 from 100.8 in Italy, the third-largest.

entry.title: Russia given 3-0 win over Montenegro in Euro 2016 qualifier
entry.summary: Two Euro 2016 qualifiers have now been abandoned in Balkan countries and results decided by default.

entry.title: UEFA gives Russia win in match abandoned due to fan violence
entry.summary: UEFA did not activate sanctions deferred after disorder by Russian fans at Euro 2012.

entry.title: Euro zone price discounting drives growth in activity
entry.summary:
Price discounting drove growth in all of the euro zone's major economies in March, helping business activity increase at its fastest rate for nearly a year, a survey showed on Tuesday.

Nevertheless, the Markit survey provided some welcome news for the European Central Bank (ECB) just weeks after it embarked on a trillion-euro asset-purchase program.

entry.title: Euro zone business growth up as new orders pour in
entry.summary:
Euro zone business activity accelerated in March at its fastest pace for nearly a year as customers took advantage of ongoing price discounting to place new orders at a rate not seen since mid-2011.

Euro zone consumer prices fell again in March, as expected, but the decline was the smallest this year.

entry.title: Euro falls near $1, but European goods remain pricey
entry.summary: Americans with a taste for fancy rides are already able to afford them, so there's no need for Mercedes-Benz, BMW or Audi to pass along the benefit of a falling euro to customers by slashing prices.

entry.title: Euro falls near $1, but European goods remain pricey
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - Americans hunting for a bargain on a new Beemer, bottle of Chateau Margaux or Hermes handbag thanks to the sliding euro should put away their gold cards.

There's no reason to think that prices for Italian shoes and French red wines will fall along with the euro, analysts said.

entry.title: Euro falls near $1, but European goods remain pricey
entry.summary:
The euro has been in a long tailspin.

In other words, you used to have to pay $1.40 to buy a single euro; today, you pay just $1.10.

entry.title: IMF says Greece confirms it will repay 450 million euro loan due later this week
entry.summary: Since 2010, Greece has been dependent on rescue loans worth 240 billion euros from other eurozone countries and the IMF.

entry.title: IMF says Greece confirms it will repay 450 million euro loan due later this week
entry.summary:
Greece is in difficult negotiations with creditors over its bailout program, which has delayed the disbursement of a 7.2 billion euro ($7.9 billion) aid tranche.

Greece must repay a 450 million euro IMF loan installment on Thursday.

entry.title: Asian stocks sag, Greek worries continue to dog euro
entry.summary:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Asian stocks sagged on Wednesday, taking their lead from weaker U.S. shares, while the dollar held to sizeable gains against a euro dogged by nerves over Greek debt negotiations.

The dollar was steady, holding to sizeable gains against the yen and euro, just coming out of its worst quarter against the greenback.

The euro tumbled 11 percent last quarter as U.S. and euro zone monetary policies diverged, with the Federal Reserve poised to hike interest rates while the European Central Bank threw itself into quantitative easing.

entry.title: Fellaini goal earns Belgium 1-0 win over Israel
entry.summary: The fixture was the only Euro qualifier of the night.

entry.title: Ten-man Belgium defeats Israel 1-0 in Euro 2016 qualifier
Euro posts record quarterly drop; Wall St ends day lower
Berkshire's Buffett says Grexit 'may not be bad' for euro zone: CNBC
entry.summary:
"If it turns out the Greeks leave, that may not be a bad thing for the euro," Buffett told cable television network CNBC.

He said a Greek exit from the euro zone could lead member countries to come to better agreement about fiscal policy.

entry.title: Prominent opponent of Merkel's euro bailouts quits leading post in German governing party
entry.summary: BERLIN - A prominent opponent of Chancellor Angela Merkel's eurozone bailout policies has announced that he's stepping down as deputy leader of one of Germany's governing parties and giving up his parliamentary seat.

entry.title: Euro bailout rebel quits senior German governing party job
Eurozone deflation eases as oil prices appear to bottom out
Premarket: Greece worries compound euro?s record quarterly fall
entry.summary: The euro remained on track for its biggest quarterly fall and European shares for their best first quarter of the euro era on Tuesday as worries about Greece's finances kept the single currency under pressure.

entry.title: Greece worries compound euro's record quarterly fall
entry.summary: New euro zone data showed a small pickup in inflation following the launch of the ECB's stimulus, and with the programme set to run for a year and a half, investors remain upbeat on the region.

entry.title: Eurozone deflation eases as oil prices appear to bottom out
entry.summary:
Negative inflation rates since December stoked fears that the eurozone would suffer a debilitating bout of deflation, where sustained falls in prices weigh on economic activity, as in Japan in the recent past.

Lower oil prices aren't the only reason why there is increasing optimism around the eurozone's economic outlook.

Though the impact of the euro's fall and the ECB's stimulus should help to prop up inflation over coming months, few economists think it will be any pick-up will be substantial partly because of rigid labor markets in many parts of the eurozone.

entry.title: Asia up on Wall St. rally and China hopes, euro sags on Greece
entry.summary: The euro looked to lose about 10 percent this quarter versus the dollar.

entry.title: Asia up on Wall St rally and China hopes, euro sags on Greece
entry.summary: In currencies, the euro was down 0.1 percent at $1.0824 , adding to an overnight loss of 0.5 percent.

entry.title: Montenegro charged by UEFA after flare chaos during Euro 2016 qualifier
entry.summary: UEFA has charged Montenegro after their Euro 2016 qualifier in Podgorica was abandoned following Russia players being hit by missiles.

entry.title: Three Greece players suffer minor injuries after being involved in fatal car crash following Euro 2016 qualifier with Hungary
entry.summary: Three Greece internationals suffered minor injuries after being involved in a fatal car crash in Budapest on Monday following their Euro 2016 qualifier against Hungary.

entry.title: Inside Hungary's 10 billion euro nuclear deal with Russia
entry.summary: Even as it scrabbles for foreign funds, Moscow is poised to make a 10 billion euro loan to Hungary, one of the European Union members most sympathetic to it.

entry.title: Cristiano Ronaldo is one of the best players in history but Serbia can stop him, says Branislav Ivanovic ahead of Euro 2016 qualifier against Portugal ?
Risk-shy banks and companies keep euro zone credit on tight leash
entry.summary:
MADRID/MILAN (Reuters) - The euro zone credit cycle is a whisker away from turning positive but don't expect a rapid recovery.

Banks' unwillingness to lend and businesses' reluctance to take on fresh debt have been at the heart of euro zone stagnation.

The International Monetary Fund has estimated that nearly three-quarters of the euro zone's 3,600 plus banks need to be overhauled before they can meet the demand for credit when the euro zone economy fully recovers.

Expectations of improving growth in the euro zone, provided the crisis in Greece and the conflict in the Ukraine does not throw things off course, are also a positive.

entry.title: German business confidence post better-than-expected increase as lower euro helps economy
entry.summary: German exports have been buoyed by the depreciating euro and domestic demand also is in good shape.

entry.title: U.S. stocks sag as euro equities, dollar gain
Euro stocks get data lift as dollar rebounds
entry.summary: The euro topped $1.10 early in the global session but was last down 0.30 percent at 1.092.

entry.title: Euro stocks rise on data, dollar rebounds
Euro zone and U.S. manufacturing expand, China struggles
entry.summary:
A sub-index measuring euro zone prices jumped to an eight-month high of 49.0.

European shares and the euro edged up after the surveys were published but the slowdown in China kept oil and commodities-linked assets under pressure.

entry.title: Strong euro zone business growth pushes euro to $1.10
entry.summary:
"Any positive surprises from the euro area are further adding to this euro/dollar rally, however we think this is temporary," said Nikolaos Sgouropoulos, FX strategist at Barclays in London.

Spain's bond yields lagged a broad rally in euro zone bonds as investors queued up for a rare sale of inflation-linked debt.

Yields on the country's 10-year bonds were up 1 basis point at 1.27 percent, while most other equivalents in the euro zone were 1-2 basis points lower.

entry.title: Euro zone and U.S. manufacturing expand, China struggles
entry.summary: The surveys pointed to first-quarter euro zone economic growth of 0.3 per cent, Markit said, matching the previous three months' but shy of the 0.4 per cent median forecast in a Reuters poll taken earlier this month.

entry.title: Eurozone economy gaining traction as survey near 4-year high
entry.summary: Markit found some hope on that front, too, noting that downward pressure on prices eased during March as a result of higher wages and rising imports costs resulting from the euro's appreciation.

entry.title: Eurozone Economy Gaining Traction as Survey Near 4-Year High
entry.summary: Chris Williamson, Markit's chief economist, said the European Central Bank's recently launched monetary stimulus has started "at a time when the eurozone's economic upturn is already starting to gain traction."

entry.title: With business activity at near 4-year high, survey finds eurozone economy gaining momentum
entry.summary: LONDON - The 19-country eurozone economy appears to be gaining momentum as a closely-watched survey found business activity at a near four-year high in March.

entry.title: Eurozone economy gaining traction as survey near 4-year high
entry.summary: In the year to February, prices across the eurozone were down 0.3 percent.

entry.title: Tsipras, Merkel urge end to name-calling
entry.summary:
Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras and German Chancellor Angela Merkel are urging an end to the vicious "stereotypes" and name-calling that have threatened to rip the eurozone apart.

Merkel said she agreed that Europe must "surmount these types of stereotypes" about good and bad eurozone members to ensure the future of the currency.

entry.title: Greece angers euro creditors with lack of info
Exclusive: Greece angers euro creditors with lack of info, wants talks at EU summit
entry.summary:
Describing the annoyance that has been building up among euro zone countries with the new Greek government's approach, one euro zone official said: "For many people the teleconference this afternoon could be something of a last straw."

They said EU leaders could not offer Tsipras anything more than the Eurogroup of euro zone finance ministers, because any further financial help to Athens hinged on reforms that Greece would have to implement, despite its great reluctance.

Euro zone officials believe Athens has made unrealistic promises it cannot now finance.

While Greece agreed early last week to restart talks with its creditors on what reforms would have to be implemented to unblock further loans from the euro zone, there has been no progress since then apart from cooperation of technical teams to gather relevant data.

Time is running out because Athens is likely to run of cash by the end of the month and may then default on its debt, potentially forcing itself out of the euro zone.

entry.title: Why the euro's next move may shock the Street
entry.summary:
The euro (Exchange: EUR=) has plunged 15 percent against the dollar over the past three months, a monster move for a major currency.

"It is going to be a long and possibly unpleasant night if you are short of the euro," Azous predicted.

entry.title: Premarket: Euro, shares rise as dollar lays low ahead of Fed
entry.summary:
The euro and world shares gained on Tuesday as the dollar steadied before a two-day meeting of the U.S. Federal Reserve, where the Fed may edge closer to its first interest rate rise in almost a decade.

The euro notched its first two-day run of gains in three weeks, a disadvantage for the euro zone?s exporters.

German business sentiment data from the ZEW institute saw a fifth consecutive rise in confidence, largely thanks to the ECB?s efforts to stimulate the euro zone economy.

entry.title: If Greece Leaves The Euro Then Spain, Italy And Germany Would Follow
entry.summary: "If Greece explodes, Spain and Italy will be next and then at some point, Germany. We therefore need to find a way within the eurozone, but this way cannot be that the Greeks keep on having to pay, "Kammenos told Bild.

entry.title: US stocks sink as investors worry about higher rates
entry.summary:
The prospect of higher U.S. rates helped send the euro sharply lower against the dollar.

The euro fell to its lowest level in 12 years.

entry.title: European Central Bank raises eurozone growth forecast
entry.summary:
The struggling eurozone economy is picking up momentum ahead of the launch next week of a 1.1 trillion euro ($1.2 trillion) stimulus program, European Central Bank head Draghi said.

The central bank for the 19-country eurozone raised its growth forecast for this year to 1.5 percent from 1.0 percent amid signs that credit is flowing more easily to businesses.

NICOSIA, Cyprus (AP) - The European Central Bank will unleash its 1.1 trillion euro ($1.2 trillion) stimulus program on Monday - and says the prospect is already boosting the eurozone economy.

The euro traded at a 12-year low against the dollar at $1.1000 after Draghi's comments.

entry.title: European Central Bank raises eurozone growth forecast
German factory orders down more than expected in January
entry.summary:
BERLIN (AP) - German factory orders, a key indicator for Europe's biggest economy, dropped much further than expected in January, led by a big drop in demand from other eurozone countries.

The fall was led by a 9 percent drop in orders from elsewhere in the 19-nation eurozone, while domestic orders fell 2.5 percent and demand from other nations slipped 2.2 percent.

The economy is in generally robust shape, with domestic demand strong thanks in part to low oil prices and a weaker euro set to help exports.

entry.title: EU court backs UK on euro trading
entry.summary: In its role as financial overseer, the ECB wanted to make clearing houses that mainly process trades denominated in euros to be based in one of the 19 euro states.

entry.title: Eurozone outlook 'brightens' as survey finds top 4 growing
entry.summary:
In one of the clearest signals of economic buoyancy, retail sales in the eurozone rose in January by a monthly rate of 1.1 percent.

Now, despite recent concerns over Greece's future in the eurozone, consumers appear to be gaining confidence.

A separate report on Wednesday found the eurozone economy grew in February at its fastest rate in seven months with the lower euro helping confidence.

entry.title: Eurozone outlook 'brightens' as survey finds top 4 growing
entry.summary:
Like most Western economies, consumer spending is a bedrock for economic growth in the eurozone and the fact that it's growing strongly and consistently - up for four straight months for the first time since records began in 2000 - is a positive signal.

The euro has fallen sharply in recent months and is trading at around 11-year lows against the dollar.

Notably, Markit found that economic activity increased across each of the 'big four' eurozone economies - Germany, France, Italy and Spain - for the first time since April, 2014.

entry.title: Greece, eurozone finance chief deny 3rd bailout in works
entry.summary: "We're negotiating a third bailout for Greece that will be between 30 and 50 billion euros. ... Greece will not leave the eurozone," the minister said, according to comments distributed to media outlets by his ministry.

entry.title: Eurozone's top official: Greece commits to avoid unilateral actions that might affect budget
European official says deal reached between Greece and eurozone creditors
Greece 'agrees deal with eurozone'
entry.summary: Eurozone finance ministers reached an agreement to extend Greece's financial rescue programme by four months.

entry.title: Greece to submit loan request to euro zone, Germany resists
Eurozone issues Greece an ultimatum; Athens hopeful of deal
entry.summary: Bankruptcy and a potential exit from the euro would loom for Greece once again.
